title: datalad add-archive-content: better documentation
body:
#### What is the problem?

1. I have no clue on how to use `datalad add-archive-content`, and the error message/documentation could be more informative.
~~2. It fails to add the content of the archive under git annex.~~ (dumb me I had `.gitignore` set to ignore the files that were in the tar)

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

I have a tarball, which is untracked. The tarball is the only file that is untracked. Naturally, I would do `datalad add-archive-content mytarball.tgz` (as the documentation suggests). I would expect this to do two things: 1. add `mytarball.tgz` to annex; 2. extract `mytarball.tgz` and add the content to annex. 

Instead, I get this error

```terminal
mvdoc@euclid ~/exp/hauntedhouse_mne/singularity (master*) $ datalad add-archive-content hauntedhouse.img.tgz
[ERROR  ] You better commit all the changes and untracked files first [add_archive_content.py:__call__:235] (RuntimeError)
```
Which doesn't really suggest that I should add the tarball to annex, but I tried to do it anyway:
`datalad add mytarball.tgz && datalad add-archive-content mytarball.tgz`, and that did the trick.

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad plugin wtf`)?

```terminal
mvdoc@euclid ~/exp/hauntedhouse_mne/singularity (master) $ datalad --version
datalad 0.9.1
```

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (Sometimes we get tired of reading bug reports all day and a lil' positive end note does wonders)

I can't live in a world without datalad <3
